text: Wanda Lavonne Jackson (born October 20, 1937) is an American singer- songwriter, pianist and guitarist. She became popular in the mid-1950s and 1960s as one of the first popular female rockabilly singers. She is known to many as the "Queen of Rockabilly" or the "First Lady of Rockabilly".Jurgensen, John. "The Queen of Rockabilly Returns". Wall Street Journal, January 21, 2011. p. D8. Her best known works were "Tears Will Be the Chaser for Your Wine", "A Woman Lives for Love" and "Fancy Satin Pillows". In 2009, she was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in the category Early Influence. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:Living people Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American country guitarists Category:American pianists Category:Singers from Oklahoma Category:Musicians from Oklahoma
title: Wanda Jackson
